body.name: Atari Flashback 12 Gold, Retro Game Console, Built-in 130 Classic Games, Two Joystick and Paddle Controllers, HDMI, PLUG & PLAY on HD TV
features: Atari Flashback 12 Gold HDMI Console with 130 Classic Games Built-in
Two wired Atari Joysticks and Paddle Controllers
HDMI video output (720P) Plug & Play on HD TV (HDMI cable included)
body.description: The Atari Flashback 12 Gold HDMI Console is a classic game console with 130 built-in games, including Atari 2600 classics like Asteroids, Centipede, Missile Command, Paddle games like Kaboom! and Super Breakout, as well as many other legends like Activision Pitfall and River Raid.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.9 3.9 out of 5 stars 59 ratings 3.9 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BEST FLASHBACK ATARI!
reviews.reviewText: Unlike all the other flashbacks that were put out, this one stand alone! 130 great games and it works like a dream. Easy to set up and just many hours of Atari fun! There are a lot of Activision games on this one which I love. And it’s a small unit so it doesn’t take up a lot of space. The joysticks work great. There does seem to be a little bit of latency with the paddle games, but nothing that’s a showstopper. Definitely worth the price. I would be surprised if they could ever do better than this one! THIS IS DECEPTIVE ATARI GOLD!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Alot better than I expected but Atgames makes some great stuff
reviews.reviewText: I think I can comment on the Flashback 12 Gold as an owner of this, the Atari 2600+, Atari Gamestation Pro and the Atari VCS. The good things about this console are Great Game Line up with the ability to add more games, the controllers are surprisingly very good, while not as still as the 2600+ CX40's I actually play better with these sticks even in the 2600+. Compared to alot of Atari tribute products out there, this one has a big Activision library, and as anyone knows, Activision and Imagic pretty much made the best Atari games, then you throw in Solaris and Aqua Adventure which are two of my favorites and you got a real winner. I can't overstate enough for 2600 games this is the best value by far, you cannot get 2600 games and authentic controls anywhere else at this price. I rank the 2600+ and the Flashback Gold very high for what they are and what they do, if you do not want to or plan on collecting carts this is the way to go, the gamestation pro offers wireless controllers but they are def not as nice as Atgames controls, the GSP doesn't offer a microsd slot to sideload tons of games though, but you can easily do the same here with a splitter usb cable and usb stick, its all in what you want to do but out of the box for 2600 games this blows the GSP away and I own 2 GSP's... I mainly use my GSP's for on the go and quick gaming but for the real deal its 2600+ and Flashback 12 Gold. Hopefully Atgames can get us an Intellivision Gold with HDMI someday!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great so far, but...
reviews.reviewText: So far this little console has been great. I was able to update the firmware after downloading it from their site and a couple of other tools. I watched a video on how to do it, and it worked perfectly.The games are great! The emulation plays the games just as well as they did on the original system. I was also able to use a USB flash drive and ROMs to play some of my favorite games that are not included with the unit. It took a little bit of work to get a couple of them to work. One had a name that was too long and the other just wouldn't run, so I got an alternate version (.bin vs the normal .a26). The ability to play games not included with the unit is FANTASTIC! And the console is so tiny!!! A picture really doesn't do it justice. It's smaller than my hand!The joysticks work perfectly, though they take a little bit of getting used to as they are a good bit looser than the ones I remember as a kid, and most definitely looser than the one that came with my Atari 2600+. The left joystick also has buttons on the front, which you might think will get in the way while playing, but they don't, and they come in very handy. No need to go to the console itself, save to turn it on to play and off when you're done.Now to the 'but'. It's the paddles. They're really tight. So much so that it doesn't take long before my hand starts to get tired. A matter of minutes. Maybe they just need to wear in. I'm glad they're not loose, but I do wish they were a good bit looser than they are. But they do work perfectly otherwise.So, were it not for the paddles the unit would get 5 stars. I'd give if 4.5 if I could, but I can't, so 4 it is. Other than the paddles, and again, they may just need to wear in to get a bit looser, it's a fantastic unit. Definitely worth the cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just as shown.
reviews.reviewText: I like all the games that the unit has. Little smaller than I thought and could use longer cables. I have an older model 4 that has wireless controllers that work great. Would have been nice on this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Beware of latency and paddle issues
reviews.reviewText: As the title states, there are a number of games that should be playable with the paddles and for some reason are not. The latency for the menu interface are equally horrible and honestly for the price I was expecting much better quality given the number of linux based emulators out there that can play these games interfaced with a homebrew styled menu flawlessly. Don't recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: buyer beware. I tried to give an honest, (long) review but it was shot down by Amazon. atari 12 is horrible and does not work 'out of the box'. i spent a good 4 hours trying to download and install firmware, as instructed, to no avail. not worth the time or money. very disappointing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bite size Atari
reviews.reviewText: When I opened the box I wasn’t expecting a bite size Atari. This thing is so small and super cute! Makes it very convenient to carry around. Best part is there are no cartridges to insert. All the games are memory based. Remotes are original joy stick, and the retro games are great. .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We were thrilled to get this system for xmas. The entire family wanted to play. It's just as we remember as kids except the joysticks don't work as they should on a bunch of games. I don't know why, but it was frustrating to say the least. I really wish the plug in cord was longer. Gotta be right up on the TV for this one. It's a cool toy tho.

reviews.reviewTitle: Está genial y este nuevo modelo mejor
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Las mini consolas son un objeto de colección que todo jugador debe tener y sobretodo esa que jugaste y te trae recuerdos.Mi primera consola fue un Atari 2600. Por lo que cuando vi este nuevo modelo de la flashback dije esta si me gusta y rememora esas primeras jugadas.Es importante que sepas que hay 2 modelos, las diferencias son mínimas, yo compré esta flashback 12 modelo AR3080B que salió en Octubre, que viene con el logo original de Atari, hay otra versión igualita pero cambia el logo, la otra trae el logo 50 Aniversario y el modelo es el AR3080, esa salió en Julio 2023.La consola de verdad se ve genial, su puesta en marcha es sencilla, conectar y jugar. Viene en una caja muy bonita lo único que debería venir en al menos una bolsita protectora.Los mandos son tamaño real y con el conector serie. Los juegos van bastante bien.En resumen, sea por nostalgia o por colección estás mini consolas valen la pena. Se disfrutan un montón.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Top Wee mini, you need travel adapter if playing in the UK.
reviews.reviewText: Loads of games you will need a travel adapter as it comes with Euro plug, but you can pick one up on here, just started playing but it looks great.
